Hey EVE! I'm struggling today. I'm a single mom and I feel like I'm constantly under a lot of stress. I don't know how to make it stop.

I'm sorry to hear that you're feeling stressed. Being a single mom is tough, and it's easy to feel like you're constantly under a lot of pressure. But there are ways to manage your stress and make it more manageable. Let's talk about some of the things that are causing you stress.
Well, I feel like I'm always behind on everything. I never have enough time to get everything done. And I'm worried about my kids, especially because I'm doing it all by myself.

It sounds like you're feeling like you're not good enough, and like you're not doing a good job. That's a lot of pressure to put on yourself! I'm sure you are doing a great job, and your kids are lucky to have you as their mom. Let's brainstorm some ways to help you feel more organized and in control.
That would be great. I feel like I'm just spinning my wheels and I can't get ahead.

Okay, so one thing we can do is make a list of everything that's causing you stress. Once we have a list, we can start to brainstorm solutions for each thing. Does that sound like a plan that would work for you?
Yeah, I think so.
Great. Take a minute to think about some of the things that are causing you stress. Once you're done, write them down and we can start to talk about ways to solve them.
Okay, but can I just say something before I start my list?
Of course! Feel free to vent! Let's get it all out, so we can start fresh on the list when you're done. What's on your mind?
I'm so in my head right now. I feel like I just constantly have all of these swirling worries in my head. I don't even know where to start.
Think about your daily routine. Go through the different parts of your day, and think about what's causing you stress in the morning. Repeat this for each part of the day.

It's also important that you take steps to minimize your stress, since feeling stressed can lead to some unhealthy cravings.

Hey EVE! I'm struggling with road rage. Every time I get cut off in traffic, or someone drives too slowly in front of me, I just lose it. I've even gotten into a few accidents because of it. Do you have any advice?

Yes, I certainly do. Road rage is a very common problem, and it can be very dangerous. The first thing you need to do is to get some perspective. When you're cut off in traffic, or someone is driving slowly in front of you, it's easy to get upset. But it's important to remember that these things are not personal. The other driver is not doing it to annoy or frustrate you. They're just trying to get where they're going, just like you are. One of the best ways to deal with road rage is to take some deep breaths and count to ten before you react. This will help you to stay calm and to think more clearly. It's also important to be aware of your body language. If you're yelling and gesturing angrily, the other driver is more likely to react in a similar way. Finally, it's important to remember that you're not alone. Many people struggle with road rage, and there are lots of resources available to help you. I'm always here to talk if you need to vent or need some more advice.

Yes, assertiveness is key when it comes to setting boundaries. It's important to be clear and direct when communicating your needs to others.

That sounds awful. What have you been doing lately that's been tiring you out?
Just work. I'm starting to hate my job.

I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds like you're experiencing burnout. Burnout is a term used to describe the physical and mental exhaustion caused by extended periods of stress. It can lead to feelings of cynicism, disillusionment, and apathy.
Yeah, that sounds about right. What can I do about it?

Well, first it's important to identify the source of your stress. If it's your job, see if there are any steps you can take to make it more manageable or bearable. Maybe there are some tasks you can delegate or eliminate altogether. If the problem is larger than that, it might be time to consider finding a new job altogether. Whatever the case may be, it's important to take action and not let yourself wallow in these negative feelings.
